decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: PP-01 Rev B, PP-02 Rev A, PP-03 Rev A, PP-04 Rev B, PP-05 Rev B, PP-06 Rev A, PP-07 Rev B, PP-08 Rev B, PP-09 Rev B, PP-10 Rev A, PP-11 Rev A, PP-12 Rev A.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed on the first floor (eastern and western elevations) of the two storey rear extension without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the roof level dormer windows in the eastern and western elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening; and the first floor windows in the eastern and western elevations shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut up to 1.7m (measured from the internal finished floor level). These windows shall be permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE:
The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
http://www.planningportal.gov.uk/buildingregulations/buildingpolicyandlegislation/current legislation/partywallact

Condition : 8 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was amended following discussion with the case officer and is now considered acceptable.  
   ii) The application was approved with an agreement to an extension of time.
description: ERECTION OF PART SINGLE PART TWO STOREY SIDE AND REAR EXTENSIONS INVOLVING THE CONVERSION OF THE GARAGE INTO A HABITABLE ROOM; ENLARGEMENT OF ROOF, THROUGH THE FORMATION OF A FLAT CROWN ROOF AND EXTENSIONS INCORPORATING SIDE AND REAR DORMERS;  ERECTION OF A FRONT PORCH; REINSTATEMENT OF CHIMNEY ON WESTERN ELEVATION; AND FENESTRATION CHANGES TO THE SIDE (EAST AND WEST) ELEVATIONS.
